documentType: institutional procedural memorandum and response to psychological reconstruction
summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Warden, dated November 13, 2019, responding to a psychological reconstruction report on inmate Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details institutional procedures for inmates with PSY ALERT status and provides point-by-point responses to findings and recommendations from the reconstruction, addressing cellmate assignments, documentation errors, and suicide prevention protocols.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at MCC New York's Receiving and Discharge area and is later observed as 'distraught, sad, confused' by a staff member during the 10:00 p.m. count.

events.title: Epstein placed in SHU with Tartaglione
events.description: Executive Staff decided to house Epstein with inmate Mr. Tartaglione in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein denied bail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was denied bail, described as a 'significant disappointment' likely challenging his adaptation to incarceration.

events.title: First possible suicide attempt/gesture
events.description: Epstein found unresponsive in his cell with abrasions on his neck and knee; cellmate Tartaglione notified staff. Inconsistent descriptions of a string or orange cloth around his neck. Epstein placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Extended attorney visits while on Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein attended lengthy attorney visits daily while on Psychological Observation, during which continuous direct observation by BOP staff was not maintained as required.

events.title: Telephone call to Karina Shaliak
events.description: Epstein was provided a monitored telephone call to friend Karina Shaliak at 5:15 p.m.

events.title: Court appearance with mental health alert
events.description: Epstein returned from court with a US Marshals Prisoner Custody Alert Notice indicating 'MTL Mental Concerns Suicidal Tendencies.' The notice was not acted upon with required urgency.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his SHU cell. The document references his death and the subsequent reconstruction.

events.description: A psychological reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein's death was completed, to which this November 13 memo is a response.

keyFacts: The document reveals that Jeffrey Epstein was initially housed in SHU with inmate Mr. Tartaglione, a high-profile ex-police officer charged with multiple murders, despite a recommendation from the Psychology Services Branch that he be housed with another sex offender.

Significant documentation errors are noted, including inconsistent accounts of Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt, incorrect data entry in SENTRY leading to multiple inmates assigned to the same cell, and a Drug Treatment Specialist improperly recreating suicide watch logs.

Procedural failures are highlighted, such as staff not following up on emails expressing concern for Epstein's mental state, not properly acting on a US Marshals suicide alert notice upon his return from court, and failing to maintain direct observation during his attorney visits while on suicide watch.

The institution's response outlines corrective actions, including eliminating Psychological Observation status, enhancing PSY ALERT procedures, increasing training, and improving accountability for inmate assignments and logbook documentation.

The document establishes that PSY ALERT status is to be applied more frequently to high-profile cases and inmates with a history or charge of a sex offense, like Epstein, to ensure continuity of care during movements and transitions.
